I am a Machine Learning PhD candidate at the [University of Bristol](https://www.bristol.ac.uk/cdt/interactive-ai/current-students/2021-cohort/nzoyem/). I hold a BSc in Mathematics from [Aix-Marseille University](https://www.univ-amu.fr) (2019) and an MSc in Applied Mathematics from [Strasbourg University](https://mathinfo.unistra.fr/formations/master/master-mathematiques-et-applications/) (2021), advised by [Prof. Stéphane Labbé](https://www.ljll.fr/membre/labbe-stephane/).

My research lies at the intersection of machine learning and physical systems found in engineering, computer graphics, vision, and more. I build the next wave of generative models and simulation technologies, leveraging my deep experience in differentiable programming, in-context learning, and meta-learning to create realistic and immersive virtual worlds. Under the supervision of [Dr. Tom Deakin](https://hpc.tomdeakin.com/), [Prof. David Barton](https://cityinthesky.co.uk/about-me/), and [Prof. Simon McIntosh-Smith](http://uob-hpc.github.io/SimonMS/), I combine expertise in AI, HPC, and Scientific Computing.

Beyond research, I am committed to equity in STEM education, volunteering for outreach initiatives with [CodeMakers](https://engineering.blogs.bristol.ac.uk/engineering-includes-me-roussel-desmond-nzoyem/), [ExamStar](https://bio.site/examstar), and [St. Theresa](https://www.stteresasfilton.org.uk/first-holy-communion-2025), among others. In my downtime, I enjoy football, playing the piano, creative coding, and building indie games.

Feel free to explore my [CV](cv.qmd) or learn more through my profile on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/roussel-desmond-nzoyem/). And [let’s connect](#contact-me) if you'd like to collaborate or chat!
